intro: Desmos insularis, commonly known as the island desmos, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has woody stems and produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Desmos insularis is considered a vulnerable species.
